item.title: The structure of the universe
item.description: Have you ever wondered what the large-scale structure of our universe looks like? Currently, the Î›CDM (Lambda Cold Dark Matter) model is the most widely accepted model for understanding the formation of structures in the universe. According to this model, small density fluctuations in the primordial universe grew exponentially due to inflation, which caused CDM to collapse in the overdense regions forming halos. Then, baryonic matter (‘ordinary’ matter) will gravitationally collapse into these CDM halos.
